meanings.definition: A member of the Women's Army Auxiliary Corps.
meanings.sent1: She joined the WAAC to serve her country.
meanings.sent2: The WAAC played a crucial role during the war.
meanings.sent3: The WAACs in the barracks always had a good laugh together.
meanings.sent4: In the army of friendship, she was the WAAC, always supporting others.
meanings.sent5: The WAACs wore their uniforms with pride and determination.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, harsh cry.
meanings.sent1: The baby started to waac loudly in the middle of the night.
meanings.sent2: The injured animal began to waac in pain.
meanings.sent3: The seagulls waaced noisily as they fought over the fish.
meanings.sent4: The thunder waaced angrily in the stormy sky.
meanings.sent5: The alarm clock waaced shrilly, waking everyone up abruptly.
